description: From Medieval Latin amalgamātus, past participle of amalgamāre, amalgama.

adjectives.description: amalgamate (comparative more amalgamate, superlative most amalgamate)

verbs.description: amalgamate (third-person singular simple present amalgamates, present participle amalgamating, simple past and past participle amalgamated)

entries.meaning: (transitive or intransitive) To merge, to combine, to blend, to join.
examples: to amalgamate one race with another

entries.meaning: To make an alloy of a metal and mercury.
(transitive, mathematics) To combine (free groups) by identifying respective isomorphic subgroups.
